item.title: confirm Examples
getElementById Examples
item.description:
The general syntax for this method is: let element = document.getElementById("element-id");Searches the HTML document for an element that has an id attribute that matches the string parameter. Returns a reference to the matching element object if match found. If NO matching element is found, null is returned. Example DOM Examples

getElementById Example

item.title: querySelector and querySelectorAll Examples
item.description: The general syntax for this method is: let element = document.querySelector("CSS selector");Uses a CSS selector pattern and CSS selector rules to find a matching element. Returns the FIRST matching element. If NO match is found, null is returned. CSS Selector Examples class selector: document.querySelector(".class-name"); tag selector: document.querySelector("div"); id selector: document.querySelector("#main"); Tip You can use any valid CSS selector with querySelector. The selectors can be simple like querySelector("div") or complex like querySelector("#main div .summary").

item.title: innerHTML Examples
item.description:
The general syntax for the innerHTML property is: element.innerHTMLThe innerHTML property of elements reads and updates the HTML and or text that is inside the element. Note The innerHTML value for empty elements is empty string "". Example DOM Examples
